metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data set of Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area
metadata.description: This data set contains the whole rock major and trace geochemical data and zircon U-Pb-Hf isotopic data of Paleoproterozoic granites in Xinyang area. The whole rock geochemical data of major elements are obtained by XRF, the trace element geochemical data are obtained by ICP-MS, the zircon U-Pb isotopic data are obtained by LA-ICP-MS, and the zircon Hf isotopic data are obtained by MC-ICP-MS. All the above data have been published in Precambrian Research, an authoritative geoscience journal, and the data are authentic. Through this set of data, the regional crustal structure characteristics and multi-stage reconstruction process can be effectively constrained.
metadata.instructions: The data is stored in Excel format and can be opened and used directly through Excel workbooks. The geochemical data of major and trace elements in the whole rock is named "2020 WR data", and the zircon u-pb-hf isotopic data is named "Zrn U-Pb-Hf isotope data".

literatureList.titleEn: Paleoproterozoic (1.96–1.86 Ga) granites in Xinyang record zoned deep crustal structure and multi-stage reworking beneath the southern North China Craton
literatureList.referenceEn: Ai, L., Ping, X.Q., Zheng, J.P., Su, Y.P., Ma, Q., Wang, X.L. (2020). Paleoproterozoic (1.96–1.86 Ga) granites in Xinyang record zoned deep crustal structure and multi-stage reworking beneath the southern North China Craton. Precambrian Research, 355, 106079.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to gather zircon U-Pb and Hf isotopic data in geological research?
Example.Answer: One data collection method for gathering zircon U-Pb isotopic data in geological research involves using LA-ICP-MS (Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) analysis, while zircon Hf isotopic data is collected using MC-ICP-MS (Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry).

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics and testing methods used for obtaining geochemical data from Paleoproterozoic granites in a specific region?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major and trace element data, zircon U-Pb-Hf isotopic data, XRF testing, ICP-MS testing, LA-ICP-MS analysis, MC-ICP-MS analysis

Quantification.Question: How many types of geochemical data collection methods are used in a dataset related to the Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area?

Definition.Question: What are the data collection methods used for obtaining geochemical data of Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area?
Definition.Answer: The geochemical data of Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area is collected using various methods: XRF (X-ray fluorescence) analysis is used for whole-rock major element geochemistry, ICP-MS (Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) is employed for trace element geochemistry, LA-ICP-MS (Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) is utilized for zircon U-Pb isotopic data, and MC-ICP-MS (Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) is applied for zircon Hf isotopic data.

Interpretation.Question: What can the integration of whole-rock geochemistry and zircon isotopic data reveal about the geological history and crustal evolution in the Xinyang region?
Interpretation.Answer: The integration of whole-rock geochemistry and zircon isotopic data can effectively constrain the characteristics of the regional crustal structure and the processes of multi-stage reconstruction in the Xinyang region. By analyzing the major and trace element data obtained from XRF and ICP-MS testing, alongside zircon U-Pb isotopic data from LA-ICP-MS and zircon Hf isotopic data from MC-ICP-MS, researchers can infer the geological history and evolution patterns of the crust during the Paleoproterozoic era in this specific area.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to analyze both whole-rock major and trace element geochemical data along with zircon U-Pb-Hf isotopic data when studying Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area?
Goal Orientation.Answer: Analyzing both whole-rock major and trace element geochemical data along with zircon U-Pb-Hf isotopic data is crucial for effectively constraining the regional crustal structure characteristics and multi-stage reconstruction processes. This comprehensive approach helps provide a more accurate and detailed understanding of the geological history and evolution of the area, as the dataset is published in a reputable geoscience journal, ensuring its credibility and reliability.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the key instrumental techniques used to gather geochemical data for Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area, and how do these techniques ensure data reliability?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The key instrumental techniques used to gather geochemical data for Paleoproterozoic granites in the Xinyang area include X-ray Fluorescence (XRF) for analyzing major element geochemistry, Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS) for trace element geochemistry, Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb isotopic data, and Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (MC-ICP-MS) for zircon Hf isotopic data. These techniques ensure data reliability by providing precise and accurate measurements that have been peer-reviewed and published in a reputable geoscience journal, allowing for effective constraints on regional crustal structure characteristics and multi-stage reconstruction processes.
